history: I’m curious what everyones favorte go to site for new vulns are. One of my favorites is https://cxsecurity.com/ just easier to browse through via web browser than exploitdb IMO.
i like this post. although i’m not a fan of aws ec2 instances. i apreciate this post. i’m going to give this a try on my linode or digitalocean vps. I’ve alsways wanted to see what i could collect.

IntroductionThis paper is how to setup your own Honeypot (dionaea). I would say most of us like Reverse Engineering binaries. Many of us have a fascination with malware. Why not combine them and RE some Malware that’s actively being used for exploitation? My tutorial is how to setup a honeypot on …

I use bleachbit. If you’re asking about a Linux version of defrago or something then you probaly want to use gparted or something.
